sentence: Menna Fitzpatrick, Britain's other competitor in the woman's visually-impaired downhill, finished fifth in what is one of her weaker events.
author: Oliver Salt For Mailonline
title: Great Britain land first medal at the Beijing Winter Paralympics as skiing star Millie Knight defeats her demons to claim bronze in the women's visually-impaired downhill event

sentence: She cut a forlorn figure after a sluggish second run in Monday’s Super Combined slalom, where she was leapfrogged by compatriot and technical specialist Menna Fitzpatrick – Britain’s most decorated Winter Paralympian athlete – onto the podium.
author: Will Jennings
title: ‘It’s been crazy’: Brett Wild and Millie Knight frustrated by ParalympicsGB’s intense schedule

sentence: +4 View gallery On a positive day for the team, Scott Meenagh (above) achieved his best ever Paralympic finish +4 View gallery Menna Fitzpatrick (above) was unable to add another medal to her collection this time around Scott Meenagh achieved the best result of his Paralympic career with sixth place in the long distance sitting biathlon while double medallist Menna Fitzpatrick was seventh in the women's giant slalom.
author: Pa Sport Staff
title: Ollie Hill creates history by winning ParalympicsGB's FIRST EVER Winter Paralympic medal in snowboarding as he earns bronze to take the nation's tally to six podium finishes in Beijing

sentence: Millie Knight of ParalympicsGB finished ninth, describing Friday’s run as “really good fun”, and Britain’s Menna Fitzpatrick finished seventh.

title: Winter paralympics 2022: historic bronze for GB snowboarder Ollie Hill

title: Snowboarder Ollie Hill blocks out social media buzz to make Winter Paralympic history

sentence: Her previous Super-G bronze was improved into a silver, her Super Combined silver was lowered to a bronze while elsewhere, Fitzpatrick was unable to snatch a slalom podium and also failed to fire in the giant slalom, where she came second in Korea.
author: Will Jennings
title: Menna Fitzpatrick eager to cement status as Britain’s greatest Winter Paralympian

sentence: Britain's only other golds at the Winter Paralympics were won by skiers Kelly Gallagher in 2014 and Menna Fitzpatrick in 2018.
title: Winter Paralympics: Neil and Andrew Simpson to carry GB flag at closing ceremony
